Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Sona_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 403 (the top floor) and thought it was great. Bathroom was modern and clean with a rain shower which was surprising! Small rooftop swimming pool. Location is great, easy to find and a few minutes from Bugis MRT. Breakfast was ok, perhaps not worth waking up early for but there's plenty of food choices around the little India area. I would definately stay at the santa grand bugis when I visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MakanShoppingQueen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 500m from Bugis MRT station. Bathroom is clean and new looking, sheets are clean, the room is quiet (we took the room that was in a separate building, stayed on the 1st storey). Bathroom has dental kit and 2 in 1 shower and shampoo gel. Breakfast is all right, I preferred the breakfast I had on Sunday when they had more choices. There was fried rice, fried noodle, eggs, green vegetables, baked beans, fried dory fish slices, bread, 2 choices of cereal, 2 choices of cut fruit and juice on Sunday. Sat was the same except they had only white rice and no noodles. My stay here was pretty pleasant, my only complaint was the carpet in the room feels a bit icky and there were small reddish stains on the carpet (blood stains?) and a little cockroach popped out of nowhere on the bed. Thankfully we didn't see any more of them, after I whacked it with a rolled up map and flushed it down the toilet with wads of tissue.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: mozilla_monster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short period over the past week, and here's what we thought: 1) Decent location - it is around 0.5 kms from the Bugis MRT station, so getting public transport isn't hard. However, there isn't any taxi ramp here, so it'll take a bit more effort to flag down a cab. 2) Decent room - we were assigned a room on the 1st floor (the one above ground), in a neighbouring building. The room is clean (we did find one roach - but I'll bet you've found roach in your own place before too), and it had most of the amenities we feel to be necessary. 3) Having stayed at the Novotel recently (much more expensive), this hotel actually provides more toiletteries compared to Novotel (there's comb & dental kit provided). 4) Check in and Check out were hassle free, and we didn't find any problems at all with the front desk service. 5) Clean, functioning bath. Cons: 1) Some of the electrical appliances don't quite work as advertised - the hair dryer, for example, refused to work beyond a few minutes at a time,. 2) We did find a roach (a small one) in the room - no major dramas there, but perhaps a sign that housekeeping can be improved. 3) The breakfast isn't a very varied spread - there's rice, soup, bread, some sausage, eggs (not an egg station, just egg cooked in whatever way they fanct for the day), some vegetable, and fruit. You do get coffee or tea and a juice as well. 4) You just get 2 bath towels - there isn't even any hand towel. 5) If you're looking for privacy, look elsewhere. I can hear every word spoken in the corridor outside my room, and there isn't any peephole at the rooms to see who's outside as well! All in, I'd love it if I could rate this 3.5 instead of 3 stars, but as it is, we can only choose between 3 or 4 here in TripAdvisor, so 3 it is.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Bugis MRT”
Reviews.Author: DarlingMayMay
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights here in October last year when the whole Singapore was full and we couldn't find a hotel in our price range in the city. Location is quite far outside but the hotel is quite close to Bugis MRT with only 5 mins walk and 10 mins to a shopping mall. Our room was on the upper floor and it was ok, clean and large, big window. Breakfast was ok compared to the price. Overall, this hotel is no so bad if you are looking a budget hotel with easy access to MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky that we were only staying for one night”
Reviews.Author: Felicity H
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, the service at reception was ok. We booked online so didn't have a printed voucher. This took abit of time to download and work out with the receptionist. Our room was very small. There was a dirty towel lying on the bedroom floor and there was building debris (paint chips etc) over the floor. The ensuite had no handsoap nor face washer......just towels. After just been to Cambodia and Vietnam where this amenity was the norm in all of our accommodation it surprised me that this was not provided in Singapore! In the morning, we were awoken by cleaning staff talking loudly and laughing in the corridor. Breakfast was poor. Breakfast staff unhelpful. This hotel was in a good spot...close to Bugis St markets etc...but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice retreat”
Reviews.Author: doctraveller11
Reviews.Content: rooms are well furnished.... nice bathroom ...clean and tidy. theres a rooftop pool from where the city looks beautiful. the breakfast was not good with very limited options. the second building doesnt have any elevator. didnt like the staff somehow.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - small, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VonGregson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights last year during the Singapore Grand Prix. When booking we had not realised it was the weekend, and so were a little surprised to have such difficulty finding somewhere to stay. We did not get off to the best of starts with the receptionist who insisted on seeing our printed voucher from the website confirming our booking. Why they could not just confirm with the company I do not understand, but we had to go throught he process of forwarding on our confirmation to the hotel for their records. Whilst a small point, this is really not what you want when you have booked in advance and arrived from the airport. The hotel rooms are small, but very clean - very much reminded me of a business hotel, which is not necessarily a bad thing. The rooftop pool is TINY, with two/three deckchairs and no space for anyone else. The breakfast included was a little odd - buffet style with the usual selection of baked beans and fried noodles. What I found strange was the sign that stated you would be charged $0.50 per gram of food wasted. I didn't see anyone actually weighing the wasted food, and whilst I think the right intentions are there, the sign left a bad taste in my mouth. The hotel is 10 mins from the Bugis metro station which is a great location, providing quick access to a lot of the Singapore sights. In a city with expensive accomodation, this hotel was fine - it was clean, comfortable and safe which is all I really ask for. However, if i were to return and it wasn't the grand prix weekend, I would research to see whether there were any better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: tinuvielSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights with my partner in one of the superior queen rooms at $170 SGD per night. We booked directly through the hotel as we found the price better than prices offered at other websites. I also wanted to get a room which wasn't in the basement, and thankfully we got a lovely room on the 2nd floor with a big window. Whilst the room is small, this is not unusual for Singapore. Importantly, the window seat helped create a bit more space to sit and relax. We also got a bath tub in our room which I really liked. The furnishings were contemporary and there was free and fast wifi. Our rooms were cleaned every day and they included complimentary local phone calls and bottled water. Overall I had no complaints whatsoever. Free transfer to the airport was included as well. I found the staff friendly, honest and efficient. I would definitely recommend ths place. Note the hotel is about 10 min walk from Bugis MRT. It is close to good shopping in Haji Lane and Bugis junction, and there is lots of eating and nightlife in the Arab St area.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and food but housekeeping is just so unprofessional and pathetic.”
Reviews.Author: anurag29
Reviews.Content: Rooms and rest room are very clean and good. also the food is tasty. we stayed there for 4 nights and we always required to call the housekeeping to clean our room, overall in 4 days our room was cleaned only twice. the housekeeping wont even listen to our request to clean the room and would argue and try to produce the proofs that they cleaned the rooms. overall it was a mixed experience.

Reviews.Title: “imagine hotel having room in basement with no windows”
Reviews.Author: Neera s
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on 17 and 18 oct 2011 thru DPAULS TOUR AND TRAVEL INDIA. we reached here after travel of 6 to 7 hr from KL. on being asked for water we were told we donot serve water in the reception. the bottle is in the room. Just imagine in India we welcome foreign tourist with garland, flower, diya and tika and here we were not even given water. we were given room in basement with NO WINDOW. When we asked for other room we were told no room available. the tour operator agent disappeared and we called india from singapore but of no use. the money to the operator has already been payed so why will they bother. In india even jail and mental asylum has one window in each cell. In the breakfast they served orange juice which was bitter, when we told them staff said that they have this only it is up to u to drink or not. the tour by DPAULS has shattered the rosy image of foreign land.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Laila_Isabella
Reviews.Content: It is my first time here so I opt for a single bed room. The balcony is awesome. Good to relax. Pool is small but enough for me to relax in the jacuzzi within the pool itself with a view..price is good. Gf came over on the 2nd day..last minute thingy and other rooms are fully booked & the staff (especially housekeeping) work together to help place the mattress beside my bed despite of the small room size. And the housekeeper keep on asking me if my gf will be comfortable with it & I said of course! And also I was down with a very bad flu & the housekeeper gave me extra tissue boxes and asked me if I am ok. Good job! Breakfast is ok..nt much but enough to fill our stomachs. Dinner & supper are done over at Arab St. Loads of nice ambience restaurants.. shisha-ing & eating etc. Overall I enjoyed my stay here. Intended to stayover here in the near future :)

Reviews.Title: “Value, clean & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kripper369
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night but impressions are good as its clean affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: AlbeeTheOne
Reviews.Content: I was doing some international travel with my friends, and we had decided to stop by to Singapore for a holiday before we head back home to India. The Santa Grand fit well on criteria for location, budget, complimentary breakfast and wifi. The hotel comprises of 2 separate buildings. We were on the upper level of the secondary building and the rooms were spacious and clean. We had arrived Singapore in the middle of the night and were looking forward for a good night sleep and a heavy breakfast, both of which we got at the Santa Grand. The breakfast menu is relatively similar every morning. In addition, the room had a coffee maker, television and massage chair and a clean bathroom with a water tub. The location helped, as the bus stop was close by though we preferred walking to see more of the city

Reviews.Title: “Average Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: steel2k2
Reviews.Content: I was on a Business Trip to SIN for 5 days and my company booked this hotel for me and this is my first time. Well, do find my review below:- 1. Cleaniness is very well kept, friendly customer service and warm welcomed - like! 2. Room has no windows, no fresh air coming into the room nor sunlight - dislike! 3. Room space is small, too small for the $ i paid for. Can hardly sit on the chair using the table and the TV is too near - dislike! 4. Breakfast not much choices, 90% the same food for 5 day stay in that hotel - dislike! 5. GYM facility located at lobby, not a very good place going in and out and the equipment very limited just 3-4 equipments - dislike! 6. Very good location of hotel. Near to Bugis, S.L.Square, and many complex... very convenient at walking distance around - like! 6. Has a "spooky" feeling when I first stepped into my room, don't know why - dislike! That's all I can ive my comments. Hope they helps. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at average price”
Reviews.Author: debojyotisaha
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I visited outside India and got the hotel booked by a travel agent. As my budget was limited, I wanted a hotel near to Little India so that I can go to to Mustafa whenever me and my wife needed. The hotel was approximately 1.5 kms from Little India so we decided to walk whenever we went to Little India. The best part that I realised after reaching is that this hotel is around 1 kms away from bugis junction, which is another shopping point for many Indians. The hotel was a small one with small restaurant attached. The package included breakfast, which was decent and had good spread. I believe, in Singapore the real estate price is expensive, so as it was a budget hotel, the room size was quite small, may be 12 feet by 10 feet, which had cupboard, king size bed, LCD TV, a table, two chairs and two side tables beside the bed. Although, the room was small but the it was fully clean, the bed had a great quality mattress, the batroom was fansactic and centralised AC. The staffs were quite helpful and offered promot service when needed. At the reception, there is a small lobby with a sofa where you can wait for your vehicle to come for local site seeing. I found something which is both good and bad is the punctuality. The rooms will be offered to you exaclty at 2 PM and for check out, you need to definitely leave before 12 Noon. So if you want to negotiate 1-2 hours extra, be ready to pay a day's rent more.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Grand Hotel Bugis”
Reviews.Author: 573maya
Reviews.Content: Customer service was wonderful. The breakfast was great. Good location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: chaychoong77
Reviews.Content: Excellant service nice friendly staff very relaxing. the first club room I was given was shabby however was immediately changed and upgraded when I requested another room - with no question. It would be good, but there is a phone to call for service when needed.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK...”
Reviews.Author: Fewe
Reviews.Content: The room was small but cosy, MRT was close, breakfast was OK, the pool was nice, the room was clean, but on the last day we find somebodys dirty underwear underneath the bed...

Reviews.Title: “cheap and peaceful nice location”
Reviews.Author: pradugar
Reviews.Content: choose this hotel for good value for money small but nice tiny clean room, tiny pool, near shopping mall and bar and massage, breakfast average not spicy limited variety, free wi-fi and net computer. safe and coffee maker inside room, guest friendly hotel, cc tv camera. all is well but advice to management improve breakfast variety add some spicy and more ,

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the Bed”
Reviews.Author: DanielSKL
Reviews.Content: Got a good rating and comments from this website, so decided to give this hotel a try. We (3 adults + our 2.5 years son) stayed for 1 night only before fly back to KL. Room seems small coz we add 1 extra bed but it was clean, no issue. We were given twin spring bed which to my opinion, quite hard (like sleeping on a wood). (Check the extra bed, surprisingly it was better/softer then the twin bed). Want to ask for change but my mind decided the opposite, so there goes. The next day wake up all my body gets it, pain. I may recommend this hotel with some note on the bed quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place, decent price, good location”
Reviews.Author: sebhoff
Reviews.Content: I can confirm what others have already written: this is not a five-star place, but it provides good value for money and the location is fine. I stayed at the Santa Grand for 5 nights while on business in Singapore and I didn't regret my choice. I had one of the few single rooms, which was small, but big enough for me. The only thing that wasn't ideal was the size of the table - barely deep enough to put your laptop on it, and the air-conditioning blew right onto that spot, too. Free WiFi worked without any problems and the speed was good. Staff were helpful and friendly. I actually had two separate bookings and was expecting to have to change rooms for the last night because the room type was different - but they informed me on check-in that I could keep the room. I didn't try the swimming pool - few people ever used it. Certainly a plus if you want to cool down and have the time to use it... While I was there, hotel guests seemed to be about 90-95% Asian tourists/travellers on business. Breakfast is fine - but if you need Western fare, your choice is limited. The Asian breakfast was quite nice, though. And yes, the smallish room can get crowded at peak times. The hotel is in an interesting area with good food close-by. It's not next to a MRT station - but within decent walking distance (Bugis or Lavender - pretty much the same distance), even on a very hot day. I've heard two people ask at the reception whether they could change to a room with a window - so I suppose the rooms in the basement aren't quite as nice. By the way, "Kubor" is Malay for 'cemetery' - the park-like area across from the hotel is an old Muslim cemetery.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Definitley Be Back!!”
Reviews.Author: Ambipoo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 8 days in July/Aug and really loved it!, The staff are super friendly and very helpful nothing is ever a problem. the breakfast was awesome, you get heaps of choices of western and Asian food, the swimming pool was devine expecially after a hard day shopping, it is very close to MRT and Little India. Also close to Bugis Street Markets. Also if you get the chance go to the restaurants behind the motel in the Kampong Glam...AMAZING!!! Cant say enough good things about this place!! Awesome holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, even better location.”
Reviews.Author: BradNZtoNSW
Reviews.Content: I don't always get why proximity to a city's CBD is always such a big deal for most travellers. The location of S.G.Bugis is excellent. It is near a MRT station, Kampong Glam and to my fiancé and I it is walking distance to Marina Bay, Orchard Road, Chinatown, CBD, Clarke Quay - anywhere really. It would be nice if the staff smiled. It isn't a big thing but being made to feel welcome by reception makes a difference. If you can't stand cockroaches then I would avoid staying here. I live in Sydney so I can handle killing a few cockroaches with my fingers if I need to. I let reception know about the problem and to their credit, a member of the maintenance team was at the room within 5 minutes with cockroach spray. My only hope is that they haven't gone ahead and said "problem solved". An infestation isn't fixed by a 5 second bug spray treatment! Overall the stay was good. The breakfast was sufficient and room size was adequate. The value was good and a major reason for a good rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: suprchick77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Santa Grand Hotel Bugis. Singapore hotel rooms are quite expensive, but in comparison to other hotels in the city, the price was good. We had a room with a private balcony overlooking a beautiful park (which I believe is actually a cemetery, but it looks like a park). The room was small (think Tokyo size), but we had enough space for all of our things. I really loved the rooftop pool. It is bigger than it looks in the pictures, and it was really nice to swim around and have such a good view of the city. There were never any other people in the pool when we went swimming, so it was quiet and relaxing. The hotel is near a beautiful mosque, many interesting restaurants and shopping areas, and a subway station. My only complaint is the unreliable wifi connection, but that wasn't a huge deal. The location was perfect for us and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small family hotel near Bugis”
Reviews.Author: mleivo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in for our stay in Singapore before and after visiting Philippines. The hotel was very accommodating, and for example allowed us to stove some luggage with them during our trip to Philippines. The hotel consists of two buildings, one an renovated old house, and the other a new one. The rooms were surprisingly large, and the facilities quite ok. The walk to Bugis junction MRT was a bit longer than anticipated, about ten minutes. Access from airport with taxi was convenient and cheap. The included breakfast was not anything special, and the breakfast room was often crowded. The reception staff was very helpful. There were some issues with the aircon in our room on both visits.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: MagsAU
Reviews.Content: 3 blocks from MRT in nice area. Hotel seems new, rooms are immaculate and of high standard. Breakfast included was basic, buit adequate. Reception did not seem to know about our package inclusions, but was eventually sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim100Uk
Reviews.Content: Trying to get the balance between price and facilities/location is always a challenge. This turned out to be a good choice once I had managed to get our room changed. Having booked a supposedly Superior room we were less than impressed to be shown to a room in the basement. It was dark, tiny with a loud droning noise from the generator room - for a light sleeper like me impossible; however after a brief discussion with reception they moved us to a room on the ground floor within 10 minutes - thank you. This room was a good size, light and airy although traffic noise was a bit of a nuisance (double glazing would have helped). As mentioned by others free high speed internet and a great little pool on the roof. Breakfast was different (rice dishes and garlic infused vegetables as well as plenty of scrambled egg) but plenty of it and why shouldn't we eat more local offerings when abroad! Staff were friendly and helpful. Located within walking distance of quay and Orchard Street but MRT station only a short walk away if walking not your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality room in Bugis”
Reviews.Author: Kat35
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not in city centre but is only 10 mins walk from Bugis MRT station along Victoria Road. It's on the main line from Changi airport. Reception staff were welcoming and Robin and Penny were especially helpful. They do offer a free shuttle transfer daily to Orchard Road at 10am. Remember to pre-book it. Hotel is clean and the room was nice for a couple of nights. The pool was small & really appreciated after a day exploring the city. It felt like our own as no one else seemed to use it! Breakfast was a nice mix of european/chinese fayre. If we can get a good rate we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My all-time favourite”
Reviews.Author: KafkaGrrl
Reviews.Content: At the promotional price of 15% discount (directly from its website), the hotel has value over money. It is one of the cheapest in town for the decent size of room and amenities offered. Although the lowest priced rooms had no windows, I was fine with it since the view outside is nothing much anyway. The breakfast was not fantastic and totally unlike 4-5 star hotels but it was tasty enough for me to take double servings. The staff were not very attentive and did not seem very concerned about giving you the best service with a smile. However, checking in and out have been relatively breezy and quick. There was once when they could not find the PayPal documents for a room I booked. That delayed my check-in. But it was no big deal. The receptionist took my credit card for deposit and returned it when the necessary documents were printed and found. I will definitely be back for a good rest and some romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: PedroPerth
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel in good location but it is too expensive for what it is. The pool is a tiny half a lap pool but great to have cool down in, the spa did not work and there was no space to laze about. The room was comfortable. The breakfast was shocking ( and I had to pay for it as I booked through Agoda but only had it the once). I stayed at this hotel twice in a short time as stopovers as part of a big overseas trip and both times I checked out I was made to wait while the front desk staff radioed to a housekeeping staff member to check my room to make sure nothing was stolen or damaged. The second time I ended up walking out because it was taking ages and I needed to get going to the airport. I will not stay at the hotel again because of the poor way they send guests off. They do have our credit card details so could easily charge us if something is stolen or broken.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended but a bit pricey for me”
Reviews.Author: khatie27
Reviews.Content: Checked-in late and was quite disappointed because the receptionist did not immediately attended me at the front desk. As I've seen her, she was having a chit chat somewhere in the lobby. Also, I was expecting to have a reliable internet wifi connection but was told that for the past few days, (if I remembered it correctly) they were having problems with their internet connection. I had to borrow a power adapter for my laptop charger but unfortunately, I needed to pay $4 for it and there were no available adapters when I called front desk. My room was well prepared and clean except that I think it's too pricey for the accommodation I booked for. Well, it's Singapore so I am not really much in shock about this. Breakfast is OK, just enough to let you choose from a variety of foods that are usually served but don't expect them to be much appetizing. I was able to have a short chat with a hotel staff in the lobby but I was really having a hard time understanding his words. However, he was very accommodating to answer my questions. Overall, I find the hotel a nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small-could be better”
Reviews.Author: skirkland68
Reviews.Content: Location was great. But there was quite a bit of noise in the area until late, so sleep was not great. The internet was FAST FAST and included in the price. Breakfast was so so. Overall I would say it is a bit over priced for this area and what you get. The door to the "secondary" building does not lock so i would rate safety as low.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Calies99
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms four months out from our arrival date and was very disappointed to find that when we checked in we would be on 2 different floors and despite paying the same amount for each room they were all different. One had a balcony, one a massage chair and the last a bigger window. The bed in my room was comfortable, king size width but not very long. The room was a good size and had all the essentials including a massage chair. The shower had a glass screen to keep the rest of the bathroom dry and was daily restocked with shower gels etc. The bed sheets were not changed daily, but the towels were. Breakfast was forgetable, nothing more needs to be said about that. The hotel is in a good location next to the Arab Quarter and there are plenty of restaraunts and shops surrounding it. The Santa Grand wont be my first option to stay at during any further visits to Singapore, but it also wouldn't be my last option

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and near to MRT”
Reviews.Author: karthiky
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore for the first time. From the Trip Advisor site got to know that this is a new hotel and near to the MRT station. When you are going to Singapore and want to go around places in an economical way, then you need to be near to an MRT station. This hotel is very near to Bugis Street MRT. The Hotel was very new and all the rooms were very clean and the price was very economical. The swimming pool on the roof was awesome and the daily complementary breakfast was good. The service was very helpful and the staff was very co-operative in helping us find good destinations in Singapore to see. Overall this was the best hotel if you want to stay near to MRT and also very economical.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunkistBobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel for 3 nights. It is at good location, walk 10 mins to reach Bugis MRT Entrance B. Bugis Junction, Iluma Shopping Mall, Bugis Street are near Bugis MRT. Ours are deluxe double bed room. The room is not spacious, but it's fine for 2 ppl. It's new, clean and comfortable. Free Wi-fi is provided. Don't expect too much on the free breakfast, just a breakfast, not many choice. Staff are nice and helpful. There is a small outdoor swimming pool at 4th Floor.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catarand
Reviews.Content: Nice location, near the beach. The room was large, clean with a comfy bed. All of the staff were friendly and eager to help. A cozy ambiance of the hotel I loved and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located at great price”
Reviews.Author: porkrib
Reviews.Content: Santa Grand is a small hotel at a great location at great price (promotion price, as compared with hotels in Singapore). The hotel is new and very clean. The room is very clean and the cleaners mopped the tiled floor in the room keeping it very clean. The room we got is small, however sufficient for us. It has all necessary amenities (safe, fridge, LCD TV, hair dryer, kettle, Wifi, etc). We saw other bigger rooms in the hotel. There is a bus stop behind the hotel, about 3 minutes walk, which will take us directly to the Orchid Road (stop at Dhoby Ghaut, Somerset, Orchard Stns). Along the road in front of hotel, there is a bus stop about 3 minutes walk which has buses to talk us to China town, etc. The hotel is about 10 minutes easy walk to Bugis Station where Bugis Junction and Bugis Street are. Along the way, you will pass Raffles Hospital which has a food court at ground floor. Walking further 10 minutes from Bugis Station will reach Sim Lim Square. Coming back from Orchid or Chinatown on bus will stop at the bus stop right in front of the hotel, across the road. All staff we have encountered are friendly and helpful. The lobby is small and always packed with hotel guests, however not a problem at all. The cafe in the hotel offer reasonable food and breakfast. They always keep the cafe clean and neat. During breakfast time, we noticed they were consistently keeping the place clean (wipe the tables, etc) and covering the food trays (when guests left them opened). An excellent place to stay. Will definitely stay again if price doesn't go up.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: orangegenie
Reviews.Content: Good location in walking distance of restaurants in Arab street area and bus route to Chinatown. Rooms were very small but had all the facilities you need, even a dvd player! Bonus also was the swimming pool which was small with only 2 loungers but perfect to cool down from the unforgiving Singapore humidity. Downside was the lack of cleaning in our bathroom and very poor breakfast. Also, other guests were very noisy and could hear other people slamming doors, tv and talking outside. Met the manager one day at breakfast and he was very friendly as were other staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ganefam
Reviews.Content: Affordable accomodation, clean and good location to MRT and Bugis Junction. Small rooms but good toilet and shower facilities. A bit noisy in the hallways as the doors are heavy.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aus9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa grand Bugis for a part of our trip in Singapore since most other hotels were sold out because of a conference. This is a small hotel close to the Bugis metro station (5-10 min walk). The rooms were tiny, the bed hard and the breakfast skippable (even though it was complimentary). The good things about the hotel - free wifi and the cleaniliness.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable, clean, and friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: g5llchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed between June 14 to June17. The location is nice. Between Lavender and Bugis MRT station. It's a good 5-10 min walk. The hotel is relatively new. The breakfast was better than I expected. Consider it's included in the price, it's not too bad. Generally it's a nice place to stay when you have limited budget and do not want to stay in one of those budget hotels. I spent S$760 for 4 nights that include breakfast and wifi. It's not cheap but it's probably the cheapest I can find during the time. The only minor problem was I sometimes here people talking in the hall way which was a little annoying sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Scot_On_Tour_10
Reviews.Content: Although I'm pretty sure I booked a room with a window, I was given one without, and there were no others available. From the second night, though, they moved me to a much nicer room - they even moved my luggage for me while I was out sightseeing. The reception staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. They were able to recommend places to eat in the vicinity and offered general advice for a good holiday in Singapore. The hotel is 5-10 minutes walk from Bugis MRT but there is a bus stop right outside the door where buses leave frequently for the centre of the city - it's well worth trying to figure out the buses. The drivers are generally very helpful with planning routes. Both rooms that I had were spotlessly clean. Yes, they're not huge, but I was only looking for a place to sleep and they're plenty big enough for that. Add in that there's a swimming pool and you get a (basic) breakfast thrown in and I don't think you can beat this hotel for value. If I'm ever back in Singapore (and I hope I am) I will definitely be staying here.

HotelInfo.Name: Santa Grand Hotel Bugis
HotelInfo.Address: No. 8 Jalan Kubor, Singapore 199207, Singapore
